first.content: A drunk man in ragged clothes stumbles through the door. He walks in cursive lines to the counter and falls onto it.

0.name: Peasent
0.content: Lass, spare a poor man one ale.

1.content: His voice is rough and slurred, barely understandable.

2.name: Peasent
2.content: Damn cats outside gave me a thirst with them high noses.

chose_option_1.name: Peasent
chose_option_1.content: Ah thank ye lass, a poor man’s drink is a blessing, (the smile on his face made it all worth it, as the man downed the entire mug with impressive ease.)

chose_option_3.name: Peasent
chose_option_3.content: I bet you’d get them cats a free one, ye fur-licker. I bet you’ll make a dog clean it, won’t ya?.

3.name: Peasent
3.content: I’ll tell you, them rebels is to make things better, but I don’t see a coper in me old pockets. Still all cats outside and hairballs in the gutter, but lil ol’ me can’t take a piss on the sidewalk

4.name: Peasent
4.content: I’ll say, you think it’s time I walk the army? War is a coming and even the blind can see! You take better care of us drunks than the king, lass

chose_option_2_1.content: He looks pissed off you didn’t hand him a free drink, slamming the door behind him. You can now see the irony in his comment.

chose_option_2_3.name: Peasent
chose_option_2_3.content: He stumbles even more than before, the ale really making its way up, yet the cheerful whistling of an old sailor song makes the day brighter.

5.name: Peasent
5.content: Oh pardon me mister, don’t mean to soil the air for ya!
